title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.16 Part 1 | 06-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: protection by the lord means complete protection 100 protection
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Arjuna was protected by Krishna's grace, comparing it to Prahlad Maharaj's protection by Lord Nrsimadeva from the demons.

segments.key_quote: Karna was born of kumti by the sun god prior to her marriage with maharaj pandu karna took his birth with bangles and earrings extraordinary signs for an undaunted hero in the beginning his name was vasusena
segments.summary: The speaker begins to describe Karna's personality, starting with his birth story and the origins of his different names.

segments.key_quote: In the same charitable spirit, he gave in charity his natural bangles and earrings to Indradeva, who being very much satisfied with him, gave him in return a great weapon called Shakti.
segments.summary: The speaker continues describing Karna, focusing on his charitable nature and how he gave his bangles and earrings to Indradeva in exchange for the Shakti weapon.

segments.key_quote: Karna was very enthusiastic to declare the news, and it is he who ordered Dushasana to take away the garments of both the Pandavas and Draupadi.
segments.summary: The speaker details Karna's involvement in Duryodhana's court, his role in the gambling match, and his anger towards Draupadi, leading to her humiliation.

segments.key_quote: I can defeat the Pandavas in five days, if Bhishma would not interfere with my plan of action.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Karna's continued enmity towards the Pandavas, his arrogant claims, and his eventual death at the hands of Arjuna due to Krishna's grace.
